Issues.Title: build: update dependency firebase-tools to v12
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [firebase-tools](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools) | devDependencies | major | [`^11.0.0` -> `^12.0.0`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/firebase-tools/11.30.0/12.0.0) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>firebase/firebase-tools</summary>

### [`v12.0.0`](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/releases/tag/v12.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/compare/v11.30.0...v12.0.0)

-   Adds `ext:dev:*` commands to publish and manage Extensions. For step-by-step instructions on how to publish your own Extensions, see https://firebase.google.com/docs/extensions/publishers/get-started.
    -   Note: These commands were previously available to early access users behind an experiment flag. There are some breaking changes from the early access version of these commands.
    -   `ext:dev:publish` has been renamed to `ext:dev:upload`. `ext:dev:upload` defaults to uploading extensions from GitHub instead of local source.
    -   `ext:dev:publish` is deprecated and will be removed in version 13.
    -   `ext:dev:delete`, `ext:dev:unpublish`, `ext:sources:create` and `ext:dev:emualtors:*` have been removed.
-   Support for Next.js i18n, basePath, and more advanced rewrites/redirects/headers ([#​5788](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5788))
-   hosting.frameworksBackend now respects omit: true ([#​5788](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5788))
-   Web Frameworks now memoizes framework builds for single builds across multiple hosting sites ([#​5788](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5788))
-   Add support for Angular i18n and baseHref ([#​5774](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5774))
-   Trip the backend requirement for Angular applications using ng-deploy w/serveOptimizedImages ([#​5774](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5774))
-   Fixes a bug where the Storage emulator would not fall back to open rules for 'demo-' projects if `firebase.json` contained multiple storage targets ([#​5170](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5170))
-   Updates `firebase init` function templates for TypeScript and Javascript to 2nd gen ([#​5775](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5775))
-   Allow for atomic deployment of Hosting content & Functions rewrites via tag pinning ([#​5753](https://togithub.com/firebase/firebase-tools/issues/5753))

</details>

Issues.Title: fix(core): allow onDestroy unregistration while destroying
Issues.Body:
Ensure that all onDestroy callbacks are called by allowing unregistering of onDestroy hooks while destroying.

Fixes #50221

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
`onDestroy` callbacks that unregister themselves when called will cause the next `onDestroy` callback to be skipped.

Issue Number: #50221


## What is the new behavior?
All `onDestroy` callbacks that are present when the destroy process starts will be called, regardless of any unregistration that may occur while destroying.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: Deprecated/Removed Class-Based Guards and Resolvers
Issues.Body:
Hello,

> Deprecated: Class-based Route guards are deprecated in favor of functional guards. An injectable class can be used as a functional guard using the `inject` function: `canActivate: [() => inject(myGuard).canActivate()]`

> Deprecated: Class-based Route resolvers are deprecated in favor of functional resolvers. An injectable class can be used as a functional guard using the `inject` function: `resolve: {'user': () => inject(UserResolver).resolve()}`.

In Angular 15, there was a **deprecation of class-based Guards and Resolvers**, which has sparked discussions regarding this decision. The deprecation of these interfaces is seen as a regression that goes against established software engineering practices. Some argue that there wasn't sufficient discussion on the topic.

As mentioned in various posts, including the one at https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/47924#issuecomment-1542123337, the removal of these interfaces has negative implications for scalability and opens up Angular to potential misuse and bad practices. This change will likely **result in class-based approaches no longer being a first-choice option for developers** - especially for new developers.

The Angular team provided quick polyfills to ensure compatibility with older code as seen at https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/47924#issuecomment-1533252207, but this doesn't fully address the primary concerns surrounding this change.

To raise awareness and gather feedback from the community, I am opening this issue in the hopes of engaging in a discussion to gain a better understanding of everyone's thoughts on this matter.

CC: @mgechev 

Thank you.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Deprecated/Removed Class-Based Guards and Resolvers" (#50234)

Issues.Title: Standalone components loadChildren() not calling canLoad
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Moving this [SO question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/75098592/whats-the-equivalent-of-canload-guard-for-standalone-components) to the angular tracker.

I was trying to use standalone components instead of modules based on the "Virtual NgModule mental model" described in https://github.com/angular/angular/discussions/43784

I had a module which had just 1 component in it, and decided to replace that with the standalone component instead

On doing that, I noticed that the `canLoad` guard was not getting called.
And after some searching saw that in the [`loadComponent` PR](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/45705#issue-1210264631) the last point mentioned was:
> CanLoad guards do not apply to loadComponent. canActivate should be used instead, just like you would do if it were simply component instead.

I could not find this mentioned anywhere in the documentation, I checked:
 - [Lazy Loading a Standalone Component](https://angular.io/guide/standalone-components#lazy-loading-a-standalone-component)
 - [loadComponent](https://angular.io/api/router/Route#loadComponent)
 - [canLoad](https://angular.io/api/router/CanLoad) / [canLoadFn](https://angular.io/api/router/CanLoadFn)
 - [canMatch](https://angular.io/api/router/CanMatch) / [canMatchFn](https://angular.io/api/router/CanMatchFn)

I couldn't conclude if this is an expected behavior or a bug ...
And if expected is this something planned for standalone components or am I using standalone components for something it should not be using

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-standalone-component-canload

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 15.2.2
Node: 16.18.1
Package Manager: npm 9.6.0
OS: linux x64

Angular: 15.2.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1502.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.2
@angular-devkit/core            15.2.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.2.2
@schematics/angular             15.2.7
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      4.9.5
```


### Anything else?

NOTE: The original SO post says canMatch does not work either - but seemed to work for me.

Looks like canMatch() works but canLoad() does not work from my experiments in: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-standalone-component-canload
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Standalone components loadChildren() not calling canLoad" (#50224)

Issues.Title: docs(core): mark toSignal as a "Developer Preview" item in the docs
Issues.Body:
Mark `toSignal` as a "Developer Preview" item in the docs. The function implementation needs to have JSDocs comment so that docs generator could parse it and use the data from the comment to generate valid docs content.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [x] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
[`toSignal`](https://angular.io/api/core/rxjs-interop/toSignal) is not marked as a "Developer Preview" item.

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?
This PR marks [`toSignal`](https://angular.io/api/core/rxjs-interop/toSignal) as a "Developer Preview" item:

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/28087049/265a79ae-88c9-44b6-906e-bb6e199fa57e)

It also adds basic docs for the parameters and **Returns** docs:

![image](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/28087049/a5a1c3a4-2524-428d-8690-74da5e406b79)


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

In my [other proposed PR](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/50142) where users can filter items based on the "Developer Preview" status, `toSignal` could not be found, even though it was marked with `@developerPreview` tag def. It looks like the docs generator only takes data from JSDocs comments from the implementation of the function, therefore I added only basic docs above the code that implements `toSignal`.

I was thinking about adding only this JSDocs comment:

```ts
/**
 * @developerPreview
 */
export function toSignal<T, U = undefined>(source: Observable<T>, options?: ToSignalOptions<U>): Signal<T|U> {
  // impl...
}
...
```

But then I saw that the docs seem a bit empty, so I added heading, `@params` and `@return` docs as well.

_Sidenote_: I updated `manualCleanup` docs where I stated that Observables can manually terminate themselves on errors as well.

Issues.Title: Erratic behavior with DestroyRef, not all callbacks are always being called upon component destruction.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

We have migrated our code base to use the new takeUntilDestroyed pipe along with DestroyRef.

Unfortunately, we have noticed very erratic behavior that with these, going so far as to not actually unsubscribe from some Observables at all after components are destroyed (I am still working on trying to provide a minimal reproduction for some cases).

I have been able to replicate some bugs consistently with the reproduction below.
https://stackblitz.com/edit/at-ng-14-router-aoffwi?file=src%2Fapp%2Fhello.component.ts

# Reproduction
This small App contains
A Service with a BehaviorSubject (bhSubject) that increments an integer and a Subject (subject) that "increments" strings.
Those two actions are performed from AppComponent, which is always visible with the buttons.
A third button "Toggle Child" will show and hide the HelloComponent, which contains the actual bug.

HelloComponent registers a onDestroy callback in each of the following cases:
1) In the callback given to subscribe() on bhSubject.
2) In a method called from the same callback given to subscribe on bhSubject.
3) In the callback given to subscribe() on subject.
4) In a setTimeout of 0.
5) In ngZone.runOutsideAngular()
6) Directly in ngOnit()

Note that a lot of the stuff is going on in the console.

## Case 1:

- Toggle Child
- Toggle Child again

### Expected onDestroy callbacks to have been called:
- 1, 2, 4, 5?, 6

### Actual callbacks called
- 2, 4, 6

## Case 2:

- Toggle Child
- Int++
- Toggle Child

### Expected onDestroy callbacks to have been called:
- 1, 1, 2, 2, 4, 5?, 6

### Actual callbacks called
- 1, 2, 2, 4, 6

## Case 3:

- Toggle Child
- Letter++
- Toggle Child

### Expected onDestroy callbacks to have been called:
- 1, 2, 3, 4, 5?, 6

### Actual callbacks called
- 2, 3, 4, 6


Following this, it seems like the first callback from a BehaviorSubject doesn't allow to use DestroyRef.

Now you might be wondering why I added runOutsideAngular() in this, it's normal it's not working there. Well, if we comment the subscription to the normal subject (line 40 to 50 in hello.component.ts) and do case 1 again, it somehow does work with runOutsideAngular(). https://stackblitz.com/edit/at-ng-14-router-d9iur8?file=src%2Fapp%2Fhello.component.ts

```ts
    /*this.someService.subject
      .pipe(takeUntilDestroyed(this.destroyRef))
      .subscribe((value) => {
        console.log(value);

        this.destroyRef.onDestroy(() => {
          console.log('Subject ' + value + ' destroyRef');
        });

        this.letterValue = value;
      });*/
```

## Case 4 (Same as Case 1, but with a subscription that is commented out):

- Toggle Child
- Toggle Child again

### Expected onDestroy callbacks to have been called:
- 1, 2, 4, 5?, 6

### Actual callbacks called
- 2, 4, 5, 6




This all seems very inconsistent. As stated before, we ran into bugs where takeUntilDestroyed() didn't work at all when used on observables within ngOnit directly (with destroyRef supplied, of course) and it wouldn't unsubscribe from all observables. Sadly I've not been able to reproduce this in a simple example yet, but this makes this new feature quite unusable. I'll keep you updated if I manage to craft a minimal reproduction for that bug as well.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/at-ng-14-router-aoffwi?file=src%2Fapp%2Fhello.component.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

_No response_

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.0
Node: 16.18.0
Package Manager: npm 9.6.4
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 16.0.0
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, localize, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.0
@schematics/angular             16.0.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Erratic behavior with DestroyRef, not all callbacks are always being called upon component destruction." (#50221)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): emit affected files as a group in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: The internal emit strategy for the TypeScript/Angular compiler has been adjusted to prefill the memory cache during the initial phase of the build. Previously each file was emitted during the bundling process as requested by the bundler. This change has no immediate effect on the build process but enables future build performance improvements.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): emit affected files as a group in esbuild builder" (#25179)

Issues.Title: PWA icons are broken
Issues.Body: ### Command add ### Is this a regression? - [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was 15.2.8 ### Description Yesterday at a workshop, we used `ng add @angular/pwa` as usual to add PWA functionality to our app. Unfortunately, the app icons were broken (on all systems used, not only macOS). ### Minimal Reproduction 1. Run `ng new foo` 2. Run `cd foo` 3. Run `ng add @angular/pwa` 4. Navigate to _src/assets/icons_ ### Exception or Error The icons in _src/assets/icons_ are broken, probably due to a bad encoding (see below). ### Your Environment ```text Angular CLI: 16.0.0 Node: 16.18.1 Package Manager: npm 8.19.2 OS: darwin arm64 Angular: 16.0.0 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, pwa, router ... service-worker Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1600.0 @angular-devkit/build-angular 16.0.0 @angular-devkit/core 16.0.0 @angular-devkit/schematics 16.0.0 @schematics/angular 16.0.0 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 5.0.4 ``` **NOTE:** I installed the PWA package to create a diff of the icon files' contents. ### Anything else relevant? It looks like an encoding issue. The PNG files in the PWA schematics package work properly, but the generated files in the workspace are broken. Some values seem to have been replaced by `EFBFBD` (left - file moved to workspace, right - original file), so the file is much larger: I think this happens outside the scope of the actual PWA schematic (i.e., in the engine).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PWA icons are broken" (#25174)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/schematics): do not generate an UpdateBuffer for created and overridden files
Issues.Body:
`UpdateBuffer` only supports UTF-8 encoded files, which causes schematics to emit corrupted binary like files such as images.

This commit also introduce an errors when the `UpdateRecorder` is used for non UTF-8 files.

Closes #25174
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "    fix(@angular-devkit/schematics): do not generate an UpdateBuffer for created and overridden files" (#25176)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow forcing esbuild builder with dev-server
Issues.Body: To allow lower overhead trial of the developer preview of the esbuild-based builder system, the development server now has an option to force the usage of the esbuild-based build system while still retaining the default Webpack-based build system for the `build` command. The `forceEsbuild`/`--force-esbuild` option can be added to the `angular.json` options for the `serve` target or used on the command line, respectively. The `browser-esbuild` builder will be used to build the application using the options specified by the server configuration's `browserTarget` option. Unsupported build options will be ignored. If using a third-party builder, a warning will be issued but the build will still be attempted. Third-party builder usage in this context is considered unsupported and may result in unexpected behavior or build failures.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): allow forcing esbuild builder with dev-server" (#25180)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/pwa): compress PWA icons
Issues.Body: This commit reduces the size the generated PWA icons.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular/pwa): compress PWA icons" (#25177)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid CommonJS warnings for relative imports with esbuild builders
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, CommonJS file warnings were incorrectly being issued for relative file imports. The CommonJS warnings are only intended to be generated for node module imports.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): avoid CommonJS warnings for relative imports with esbuild builders" (#25167)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): clean incoming index URL before processing in esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with the development server, the incoming URL for the index HTML may contain search parameters or other URL elements that can cause the index HTML content to not be found or processed incorrected by the development server. These elements are cleaned prior to comparison and the original URL is not longer passed to Vite to avoid unneeded Vite specific processing of the content.

Closes #25080
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): clean incoming index URL before processing in esbuild builder" (#25170)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): show error note for CSS url() tilde usage in esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with a `url()` in a stylesheet that uses that Webpack-specific tilde prefix, a note will be added to the resolution error providing additional information regarding the removal of the tilde.

Closes #25089
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): show error note for CSS url() tilde usage in esbuild builder" (#25171)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): convert dev-server glob proxy entries for esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder with the development server, an underlying Vite server is used. The Vite server currently does not support glob-based entries for the proxy configuration. They must either be prefix strings or regular expressions. The Webpack-based development server, however, does support globs. To remove the need to have different proxy configuration files for the two servers, the entries will now be normalized to regular expressions when using the Vite server. This allows existing proxy configurations to work without modification.

(cherry picked from commit 892fcc6892acbc4e951be9afd5e00d501899e09c)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): convert dev-server glob proxy entries for esbuild builder" (#25166)

Note: release notes for v1.31.0 were removed, as the change to `DEFAULT_YQ_VERSION` was more breaking than we realized, and not meeting our semver guarantee.
Please do not use that release.

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

1.  Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2.  Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "1.31.1")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "5f3443b1d98a462a8b7330f4742483afc8b2d17c8555dd97ce4146f43e961718",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-1.31.1",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/releases/download/v1.31.1/bazel-lib-v1.31.1.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

```

Optional toolchains:

```starlark

### Register the following toolchain to use jq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_jq_toolchains")

register_jq_toolchains()

### Register the following toolchain to use yq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_yq_toolchains")

register_yq_toolchains()
```

Issues.Title: generators: allow dash `-` in selector before a number
Issues.Body: ### Command generate ### Description We use jira. Tickets always follow the schema `-` so e.g. `Task-123`. If we do an a/b test, we like to postfix the files that mirror the control group with the ticket, so e.g `feature-task-123.component.ts`. But the cli right now doesn't allow this. See `ng g c TodoItemTask123` neither the files nor the selector have the `-`. So `task-123` is actually `task123`: So what I'd like to do would be one of these: ``` ng g c TodoItemTask-123 ng g c TodoItemTask123 --selector app-todo-item-task-123 ``` but both commands get rejected with `Selector "app-todo-item-task-123" is invalid`: ### Describe the solution you'd like I'd like if `ng g c TodoItemTask-123` was allowed and generates files like: ``` todo-item-task-123.component.ts ^ having the dash ``` ### Describe alternatives you've considered Renaming all the files and updating the NgModule by hand afterwards.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "generators: allow dash `-` in selector before a number" (#25164)

Issues.Title: Angular Jest test runner not compatible with test tables (`it.each(...`)
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

While trying the experimental Jest test runner (by modifying `angular.json` as detailed in the [blog post](https://blog.angular.io/moving-angular-cli-to-jest-and-web-test-runner-ef85ef69ceca)), to write [Jest test tables](https://jestjs.io/docs/api#testeachtablename-fn-timeout).

First, Typescript complains that `.each` does not exist. This was fixed by installing the types with both npm and alterting `tsconfig.json` (instructions and example below).

However while this removes the compilation error in VSCode, it does not get the tests running. When using `ng test` an exception is raised (see below).

What has to be done to ensure the Angular test runner can use Jest test tables

Install the Jest types:

```shell
$ npm install --save-dev @types/jest
```

Update `tsconfig.json`:

```json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        [...]
        "types": ["jest"]
    }
}
```

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
NOTE: The Jest builder is currently EXPERIMENTAL and not ready for production use.
The esbuild-based browser application builder ('browser-esbuild') is currently in developer preview and is not yet recommended for production use. For additional information, please see https://angular.io/guide/esbuild
✘ [ERROR] TS2339: Property 'each' does not exist on type '(expectation: string, assertion?: ImplementationCallback | undefined, timeout?: number | undefined) => void'. [plugin angular-compiler]

    src/utils/placeholder.utils.spec.ts:11:11:
      11 │         it.each(testTable)("should return the expected display nam...
         ╵            ~~~~
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 16.0.0
Node: 18.16.0
Package Manager: npm 9.5.1
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 16.0.0
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, material, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1600.0
@angular-devkit/build-angular   16.0.0
@angular-devkit/core            16.0.0
@angular-devkit/schematics      16.0.0
@schematics/angular             16.0.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.0.4
```


### Anything else?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Cannot install local version
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

After a clean install of the [forked repo](https://github.com/Xaconi/angular-cli), the clean install is ok (with `yarn` command). Then the build is ok... I suppose (it doesn't prompt me any error with the `yarn build --local` command). But then, when I try to install this local version on a new Angular project (with `npm install -D ../angular-cli/dist/*.tgz` command), it prompts me this error:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1944438/236704385-bbba2d6e-8661-4288-be0f-ff992388869a.png)

Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When I use relative imports with '.js' extension from TypeScript, the module is not found.
`./src/common/Synchronizer.ts:3:0-61 - Error: Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '../inez/repositories/actions.js' in '/home/mag/project/KodeKonveyor/angulartest/src/common`

I converted the code to this style because the unit testing tool I use can work reasonably fast (without bundling) with ESM modules.

I do believe that requiring relative imports with extensions for ESM modules in TypeScript is a bug of the TypeScript compiler, but they treat it as a feature. So here we are.

Issues.Title: feat(MatTable): Sticky columns and rows shouldn't hide focused element
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

If there are focusable elements in my table, and the user is focused on one, I'd like it not to be hidden by sticky columns or rows. I imagine this is a browser-caused issue, but could be resolved with a bit of code.

This is a demonstration of how these td elements are focusable with a sticky column, but as the user navigates, the focus is lost behind the focused column. I'd like the table to auto-scroll so that the focused cell is not behind the sticky column.
![sticky column scroll issue](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/59396813/16b40fe5-afc3-4641-bde0-8b3f6c075a58)


### Use Case

Situations where there are focusable elements in a table. This could be inputs, buttons, custom focusable elements, etc.

Here is a stackblitz demonstration I started off of Angular Material's site that I modified slightly to show this issue.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/hqxmcp?file=src%2Fapp%2Ftable-sticky-columns-example.html,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-sticky-columns-example.ts,src%2Fapp%2Ftable-sticky-columns-example.css

![focus sticky issue](https://github.com/angular/components/assets/59396813/8fe58f5f-05b1-4e4c-b0c8-76a1482daa4b)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatTable): Sticky columns and rows shouldn't hide focused element" (#27074)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-calendar): Console warning from mat-calendar component
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I noticed that the `mat-calendar` component is showing a console warning. Here's the warning message:

```
[Violation] Added non-passive event listener to a scroll-blocking 'touchmove' event.
Consider marking event handler as 'passive' to make the page more responsive.
See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5745543795965952
```

The component is defined in the `MatCalendarTestComponent` Angular component. Here's the code:

```
@Component({
  selector: 'app-mat-calendar-test',
  template: '<mat-calendar />',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [
    MatNativeDateModule,
    MatDatepickerModule,
  ]
})
export class MatCalendarTestComponent {}
```

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. create a standalone component
2. import MatNativeDateModule and MatDatepickerModule
3. declare `mat-calendar`


### Expected Behavior

This console warning should not show.

```
[Violation] Added non-passive event listener to a scroll-blocking 'touchmove' event.
Consider marking event handler as 'passive' to make the page more responsive.
See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5745543795965952
```

### Actual Behavior

Declaration of `mat-calendar` shows this console warning.

```
[Violation] Added non-passive event listener to a scroll-blocking 'touchmove' event.
Consider marking event handler as 'passive' to make the page more responsive.
See https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5745543795965952
```

### Environment

- Angular: 16.0.0
- CDK/Material: 16.0.0
- Browser(s): Google Chrome 112
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): WIndows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-calendar): Console warning from mat-calendar component" (#27072)

Issues.Title: Mat Focus Indicator breaks mat-icon with font awesome
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was 14 ### Description The following mat-focus-indicator class is applied to mat-icon in chips. This class sets ::before to display: none. This breaks font libraries such as fontawesome which use the ::before psuedoselector. As it causes the icon to be hidden. Additionally, in other places, this same class appears to remove the content attribute, which is how the icons are displayed. ### Reproduction Steps to reproduce. Create a mat-icon using font awesome, make it a button for example {{fruit}} See that the class mat-focus-indicator nukes the icon by setting ::before to display: none; ### Expected Behavior mat-focus-indicator should not set display: none on ::before as it impacts all other ::before psuedoselectors ### Actual Behavior Not overriding icons which use the ::before psuedoselector ### Environment - Angular: - CDK/Material: 16 (and 15) - Browser(s): Edge - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat Focus Indicator breaks mat-icon with font awesome" (#27067)

Issues.Title: bug(Chips): Screen reader does not announce proper selected state when multiselect enabled
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using Chips component that allows multiple options to be selected, screen reader does not announce the state correctly and causes confusion for customers. Without `multiple` attribute screen reader announces the "selected/not selected" state as expected.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open basic example from the Chips doc:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10143921/236651172-75b9d303-f1ca-4fe8-90c7-2d975d14d0af.png)

2. Add `multiple` attribute to `mat-chip-listbox` to allow multiselect.
```
<mat-chip-listbox multiple aria-label="Fish selection">
  <mat-chip-option>One fish</mat-chip-option>
  <mat-chip-option>Two fish</mat-chip-option>
  <mat-chip-option color="accent" selected>Accent fish</mat-chip-option>
  <mat-chip-option color="warn">Warn fish</mat-chip-option>
</mat-chip-listbox>
```

3. Turn on a screen reader and navigate between chip options.

### Expected Behavior

When multiselect enabled, when clicking/tabing on a chip, screen reader announces:

- (when option selected) "{label} selected"
- (when option not selected) "{label} not selected"

### Actual Behavior

When multiselect enabled, when clicking/tabing on a chip, screen reader announces:

On MacOS + VoiceOver:
- (when option selected) "{label} selected, selected"
- (when option not selected) "{label} not selected, selected"

On Linux + Orca:
- (when option selected) "{label}"
- (when option not selected) "{label} not selected"

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10143921/236651100-b67ed0d2-d84e-47d9-9df3-387fabefb302.png)

### Environment

Not a custom env, able to reproduce in basic example on StackBlitz in Chrome:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10143921/236651165-6bb42b01-1e5a-4638-b893-a23c3542ed59.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(Chips): Screen reader does not announce proper selected state when multiselect enabled" (#27053)

Issues.Title: feat(mat-select): replace inline svg
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Hi!
Our company is currently working on some rebranding so we decided to update to Angular Material 15 to get rid of the deprecation notices. 

The problem that since the chevron in the mat-select is an inline SVG, it's really hard to replace and I couldn't find a nice solution to replace the SVG in a way that doesn't easily break when updating Material.

I suggest that having the SVGs externally might not be a bad idea since that would make it easier to theme Material while providing the most flexibility for users.

Any thoughts on that? or maybe is there already a better solution?

### Use Case

This suggestion would allow for easier theming since most (company) style guides often include custom icons like chevrons that are integrated into components like mat-select.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "feat(mat-select): replace inline svg" (#27064)

Issues.Title: build: generate a new app in ng new test
Issues.Body:
Currently the `ng new` integration test uses a pre-generated app which we need to keep up to date. This can cause us to miss changes in the project structure between CLI versions.

These changes switch to generating the project on-the-fly and adding Material to it instead.

I've only done this for the standalone test to verify the approach, but it should be applied to the `ng add` test as well.

Issues.Title: feat(material/tabs): ink bar animation synchronize
Issues.Body:
feat(material/tabs): ink bar animation synchronize

The animation of the ink bar of the mat tab group and the mat tab nav bar is now synchronized with the animationDuration of the tab body. When the animation duration of the tab body was set to e.g. 0ms the ink bar still had an animation of 500ms. The following feat extends the animationDuration property to not only affect the tab body but also the ink bar of the tab group and the tab nav bar.

Fixes angular#25068
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(material/tabs): ink bar animation synchronize" (#27056)

Issues.Title: bug(COMPONENT): ng update failes without spec files
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

ng update @angular/cdk from 15.x to 16 fails if there are no spec.ts or d.ts files in the app folder. This is the case for projects that are created with --skip-tests. 

Workarround is: create an empty d.ts file

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. create a project using --skip-tests
2. make sure that there are no d.ts or spec.ts files
3. run ng update including material or cdk 


### Expected Behavior

migrations run

### Actual Behavior

✖ Migration failed: error TS18003: No inputs were found in config file 'tsconfig.json'. Specified 'include' paths were '["src/**/*.spec.ts","src/**/*.d.ts"]' and 'exclude' paths were '["./out-tsc/spec"]'.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.x
- CDK/Material: 15.x
- Browser(s): none
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(COMPONENT): ng update failes without spec files" (#27055)

Issues.Title: bug(MatTable): Jumpy MatPager when inside expandable MatTable
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

With your [examples section](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples), there are demos for using expandable `MatTable`, with the help of `ngTemplateOutlet`, and there are demos for using `MatPager`. But there isn't a single example of using both. And if there were, you would see that when combining expandable `MatTable` with `MatPager`, it no longer looks well.

What happens - every time we expand a panel, all panels that are below + the pager show an animation artifact whereby the whole thing jumps lower first, and then it jumps back up, which doesn't look well. Just as we remove `MatPager` from expandable `MatTable`, that artifact disappears.

### Reproduction

Take any of the [existing examples](https://material.angular.io/components/table/examples) of expandable `MatTable` (with template), and add `MatPager` into such demo, you will get the undesired effect of jumpy animation upon expansion.


### Expected Behavior

When adding `MatPager` into expandable `MatTable`, the latter must continue animating as before.

### Actual Behavior

Once `MatPager` is added into expandable `MatTable`, expansion of any item results in a jump of all items below + the pager.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.2.9
- CDK/Material: 15.2.9
- Browser(s): Chrome 112
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(MatTable): Jumpy MatPager when inside expandable MatTable" (#27052)

Issues.Title: feat(checkbox, radio): Provide a way to vertically align checkboxes and radios in stacked layouts
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

MDC increased checkbox and radio touch areas. It means that in a stacked layout, the checkboxes/radios are visually indented to the right.
It can be seen in the checkbox docs: https://material.angular.io/components/checkbox/examples (the "Checkboxes with reactive forms" example).

It makes forms visually unbalanced - because other elements (labels, text inputs) don't have such indentation.

While a workaround with custom CSS is possible, it would relies on internal details of the Material components (sizes).

It would be great to have the official / documented way to do that. Maybe expose a variable as public API, add an Input to the components, or something else.

### Use Case

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(checkbox, radio): Provide a way to vertically align checkboxes and radios in stacked layouts" (#27049)
